Sentencas: A liquid antimony (Sb) anode is examined at 1073 K in solid oxide fuel cells with single-crystal yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) electrolytes.
Titulo: Polarization characteristics of liquid antimony anode with smooth single-crystal solid oxide electrolyte

Sentencas: Cells featuring a smooth electrolyte surface (Sa = 0.69 nm) are operated under battery mode with dry Ar flow in the anode chamber to characterize the electrochemical oxidation of the metals by oxygen ions while avoiding the effects of the electrolyte surface morphology.
Titulo: Polarization characteristics of liquid antimony anode with smooth single-crystal solid oxide electrolyte

Sentencas: The intrinsic anode polarization of the liquid Sb anode is obtained, revealing that the Sb anode polarization was the main cause of performance loss.
Titulo: Polarization characteristics of liquid antimony anode with smooth single-crystal solid oxide electrolyte

Sentencas: Because liquid Sb2O3 can transfer oxygen ions, the reaction product Sb2O3 decreases the anode polarization and enhances the performance by increasing the effective reaction interface.
Titulo: Polarization characteristics of liquid antimony anode with smooth single-crystal solid oxide electrolyte

Sentencas: The liquid three-dimensional electrode is formed by discharging.
Titulo: Polarization characteristics of liquid antimony anode with smooth single-crystal solid oxide electrolyte

Sentencas: The anode polarization can be reduced by changing the ratio of Sb and Sb2O3 in the anode.
Titulo: Polarization characteristics of liquid antimony anode with smooth single-crystal solid oxide electrolyte

Sentencas: Using 50% Sb + 50% Sb2O3 as the anode, the anode resistance is reduced to 0.8 Omega cm(2), which is comparable to typical porous solid anodes.
Titulo: Polarization characteristics of liquid antimony anode with smooth single-crystal solid oxide electrolyte
